name: Cheese Danish
description: This buttery, flaky, and budget-friendly Cheese Danish recipe is ridiculously easy to make and can be on your table in under a half hour.

recipeInstructions.text: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Place your oven's rack in the center and preheat it to 400Â°F. Mix the cream cheese, powdered sugar, vanilla, egg yolk, and salt until smooth and light in texture.
recipeInstructions.name: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Place your oven's rack in the center and preheat it to 400Â°F. Mix the cream cheese, powdered sugar, vanilla, egg yolk, and salt until smooth and light in texture.

recipeInstructions.text: Unfold the sheet of puff pastry, dust off excess flour, and place it on the baking sheet. Cut down the seams of the folds so you have three equal-sized strips. Cut the strips into halves.
recipeInstructions.name: Unfold the sheet of puff pastry, dust off excess flour, and place it on the baking sheet. Cut down the seams of the folds so you have three equal-sized strips. Cut the strips into halves.

recipeInstructions.text: Use a fork to perforate around the sides of each puff pastry rectangle, leaving a half-inch border. This prevents the puff pastry from rising in the middle.
recipeInstructions.name: Use a fork to perforate around the sides of each puff pastry rectangle, leaving a half-inch border. This prevents the puff pastry from rising in the middle.

recipeInstructions.text: Add 2 heaping tablespoons of your cream cheese mixture to each square. Spread evenly, making sure to leave the borders clean.
recipeInstructions.name: Add 2 heaping tablespoons of your cream cheese mixture to each square. Spread evenly, making sure to leave the borders clean.

recipeInstructions.text: Beat the egg white until frothy. Dip a pastry brush into the beaten egg white and trace lightly along the borders. This will give the puff pastry a glossy finish and golden color.
recipeInstructions.name: Beat the egg white until frothy. Dip a pastry brush into the beaten egg white and trace lightly along the borders. This will give the puff pastry a glossy finish and golden color.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake at 400Â°F for 10 minutes then rotate the baking sheet, front to back. Continue to bake for 5 to 10 minutes, or until the borders of the puff pastry have risen and are golden brown. Use a spatula to remove the pastries from the sheet pan and cool on a rack.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake at 400Â°F for 10 minutes then rotate the baking sheet, front to back. Continue to bake for 5 to 10 minutes, or until the borders of the puff pastry have risen and are golden brown. Use a spatula to remove the pastries from the sheet pan and cool on a rack.

recipeInstructions.text: In a separate bowl, mix the powdered sugar, vanilla, and milk. Finally, drizzle over cooled Cheese Danish and watch your loved ones gobble them down! Optional: drizzle with 2 tablespoons of strawberry jam thinned with 1 teaspoon of water.
recipeInstructions.name: In a separate bowl, mix the powdered sugar, vanilla, and milk. Finally, drizzle over cooled Cheese Danish and watch your loved ones gobble them down! Optional: drizzle with 2 tablespoons of strawberry jam thinned with 1 teaspoon of water.

review.reviewBody: 8 oz cream cheese is now $4.98 and a box of puff pastry (2 pcs) $6.99. But the recipe is divine.

Thank you! Just wanted to leave 5 stars for you. A really quick and easy reference that I needed ðŸ˜Š they turned out great. The filling was the right amount for two sheets for me - but I also baked a compote on top, so depending on how much filling you want it could still work for a single sheet.  

One trick that works great for the over spill - start with a little less filling, after the pastry starts to puff at the edges in the oven pull it out and add the rest of the filling so itâ€™s contained and then finish baking.  Helpful if you like a lot of filling.  Cooling on a wire wrack also prevents the bottoms from getting soft.

These danishes baked up nicely! I wanted to lower the carbs so I substituted a monkfruit erythritol powdered sweetener and added 1 t lemon juice to filling... I skipped the icing but will top with some of my homemade sugar free strawberry preserves!

Tried exactly as written. Very yummy but i would do these tweaks for our family's taste next time. Increase sugar throughout in cream cheese mixture and drizzle.Reduce cream cheese mixture to 2/3 of the said amount as i had to throw away few tbsps. As ovens are different keep a close watch mine was done in 13 mins total.
If you followed the recipe and can bake, these turn out perfect. Divine!
Amazing, And very helpful instructions. I am an 11 year old and it was super easy for me to do! Thank you so much!
This was a good treat! We had leftover pastry and cream cheese from Christmas. We did the strawberry jam drizzle. One bit did taste a bit eggy so I had to hold one star back.
Delicious, but I would halve the cream cheese mix. It was way too much. Also put significantly less milk in the icing (maybe a half tbsp), it was watery as written.

I added a little lemon to the filling, like the other commenters suggested, and it turned out very nice. My only edit is that next time I might try making twelve, using both pieces of puff pastry in the package, instead of six. I didn't measure as I scooped the filling, just divided it evenly because I didn't want to waste any, and some were a little overloaded.
I loved this recipe! Easy to follow and turned out so yummy :)
One thing missing is a little lemon juice in the cream cheese. Disregard the salt....not needed. Other then that great recipe. Bon AppÃ©tit!

I really hoped this recipe would taste like the bakery but for some reason the cream cheese filling seemed too much like an egg breakfast filling. Do you think omitting the egg yolk would help with that or possibly not putting as much egg yolk in by maybe scrambling a little into the cream cheese mixture? Iâ€™ll have to experiment myself if a response isnâ€™t received. Glad this recipe is up!

Made this tonight with the lemon zest in the cream cheese mixture and I thinly sliced a couple of peaches and laid slices over the danishes before turning them for the final ten minutes of cooking. When they came out, I sprinkled a little coarse sugar on the top. Absolutely phenomenal.

keywords: Cheese Danish, Cream Cheese Danish, Danish
